section.title: Install from pypi
section.programlisting: pip install imgui-bundle pip install opencv-contrib-python

callout.para: in order to run the immvision module, install opencv-python or opencv-contrib-python

section.simpara: Note: under windows, you might need to install msvc redist.

section.title: Install from source:
section.programlisting: git clone https://github.com/pthom/imgui_bundle.git cd imgui_bundle git submodule update --init --recursive pip install -v . pip install opencv-contrib-python

callout.para: Since there are lots of submodules, this might take a few minutes
The build process might take up to 5 minutes

section.title: Run the python demo
section.simpara: The source for the demos can be found inside bindings/imgui_bundle/demos_python.

tip.simpara: Consider demo_imgui_bundle as an always available manual for Dear ImGui Bundle with lots of examples and related code source.

section.title: Integrate Dear ImGui Bundle in your own project in 5 minutes
section.simpara: The easiest way to use Dear ImGui Bundle in an external project is to use the example provided in example_integration. This folder includes everything you need to set up your own project.

section.title: Build from source
section.simpara: If you choose to clone this repo, follow these instructions:
section.programlisting: git clone https://github.com/pthom/imgui_bundle.git cd imgui_bundle git submodule update --init --recursive mkdir build cd build cmake .. -DIMMVISION_FETCH_OPENCV=ON make -j

callout.para: Since there are lots of submodules, this might take a few minutes
The flag -DIMMVISION_FETCH_OPENCV=ON is optional. If set, a minimal version of OpenCV will be downloaded a compiled at this stage (this might require a few minutes)

sidebar.simpara: The immvision module will only be built if OpenCV can be found. Otherwise, it will be ignored, and no error will be emitted.

section.title: Run the C++ demo
section.simpara: If you built ImGuiBundle from source, Simply run build/bin/demo_imgui_bundle.
The source for the demos can be found inside bindings/imgui_bundle/demos_cpp.

tip.simpara: Consider demo_imgui_bundle as a manual with lots of examples and related code source. It is always available online
